title: My Lab Journal
text: This is a template example for lab journaling. Students in the data science courses at the Institute of Entrepreneurship will use this template to learn R for business analytics. Students can replace this text as they wish.

title: My Lab Journal
text:
How to use

Accept the assignment and get your own github repo.
Blog/journal what you are doing in R, by editing the .qmd files.
See the links page for lots of helpful links on learning R.
Change everything to make it your own.
Make sure to render you website every time before you want to upload changes.

title: Statistical Concepts
text:
random_vars <- readRDS("random_vars.rds")
"expected value of age"

#> [1] "expected value of age"

mean(random_vars$age)

#> [1] 33.471

"expected value of income"

#> [1] "expected value of income"

mean(random_vars$income)

#> [1] 3510.731



"variance of age"

#> [1] "variance of age"

var(random_vars$age)

#> [1] 340.6078

"variance of income"

#> [1] "variance of income"

var(random_vars$income)

#> [1] 8625646



"std of age"

#> [1] "std of age"

sd(random_vars$age)

#> [1] 18.45556

"std of income"

#> [1] "std of income"

sd_income <- sd(random_vars$income)

"The standard deviation of the income is a lot higher than the deviation of the age. This means that the samples of the income are more far to the mean and to each other. "

#> [1] "The standard deviation of the income is a lot higher than the deviation of the age. This means that the samples of the income are more far to the mean and to each other. "



"covvariance of age and income"

#> [1] "covvariance of age and income"

cov(random_vars$age,random_vars$income)

#> [1] 29700.15

"correlation of age and income "

#> [1] "correlation of age and income "

cor(random_vars$age,random_vars$income)

#> [1] 0.5479432

"The correlation is easier to interpret because it provides a standardized scale. it is dimensionless."

#> [1] "The correlation is easier to interpret because it provides a standardized scale. it is dimensionless."



"E[income/age<=18]"

#> [1] "E[income/age<=18]"

weighted.mean(random_vars[random_vars$age<=  18,'income'])

#> [1] 389.6074

"E[income/age<18 and >65]"

#> [1] "E[income/age<18 and >65]"

weighted.mean(random_vars[random_vars$age>18 & random_vars$age<65 ,'income'])

#> [1] 4737.609

"E[income/age>=65]"

#> [1] "E[income/age>=65]"

weighted.mean(random_vars[random_vars$age>=65 ,'income'])

#> [1] 1777.237

title: Causality
text:
library(tidyverse)

#> Warning: le package 'tidyverse' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'ggplot2' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'tibble' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'tidyr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'readr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'purrr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'dplyr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'stringr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'forcats' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> Warning: le package 'lubridate' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
#> ✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.4
#> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
#> ✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
#> ✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
#> ✔ purrr     1.0.2     
#> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
#> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
#> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
#> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)
years<- c(1999,2000,2001,2002,2003,2004,2005,2006,2007,2008,2009)
suicides<- c(5427,5688,6198,6462,6635,7336,7248,7491,8161,8578,9000)
spending <- c(18.079,18.594,19.753,20.734,20.831,23.029,23.597,23.584,25.525,27.731,29.449)
scale= 300
data <- data.frame(years,suicides,spending)
ggplot(data=data,aes(x=years,y=spending))+
  geom_line(aes(color =" Spending"))+
  geom_line(aes(y=suicides/scale,color="suicide"))+
  scale_y_continuous(sec.axis = sec_axis(~.*scale, name="suicide")) +
  labs(x = "years", y = "Spending", color = "") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue", "red"))







r<- cor(suicides,spending)

title: Directed Acyclic Graphs
text:
library(dagitty)

#> Warning: le package 'dagitty' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2

library(ggdag)

#> Warning: le package 'ggdag' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> 
#> Attachement du package : 'ggdag'


#> L'objet suivant est masqué depuis 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter

model <- dagify(
sales ~ location,
parking_spots~ location,
sales ~ parking_spots,
coords = list( x= c(sales = 3, location = 2,parking_spots = 1),
                y = c(sales = 0, location = 1, parking_spots = 0))
)
ggdag(model) +
  geom_dag_point(color = "white") +
  geom_dag_text(color = "blue") +
  geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "blue")









customer_sat <- readRDS("customer_sat.rds")
model <-lm(customer_sat$satisfaction~customer_sat$follow_ups)
summary(model)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = customer_sat$satisfaction ~ customer_sat$follow_ups)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -12.412  -5.257   1.733   4.506  12.588 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                         Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)              78.8860     4.2717  18.467 1.04e-10 ***
#> customer_sat$follow_ups  -3.3093     0.6618  -5.001 0.000243 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.658,  Adjusted R-squared:  0.6316 
#> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 0.0002427

model2 <- lm(customer_sat$satisfaction + customer_sat$follow_ups~ customer_sat$subscription)
summary(model2)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = customer_sat$satisfaction + customer_sat$follow_ups ~ 
#>     customer_sat$subscription)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>    Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
#>   -6.6   -1.6   -0.2    1.9    6.4 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                                   Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)                         53.600      2.013  26.623 4.84e-12 ***
#> customer_sat$subscriptionPremium    23.000      2.847   8.078 3.40e-06 ***
#> customer_sat$subscriptionPremium+   13.600      2.847   4.777 0.000451 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 4.502 on 12 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.8461, Adjusted R-squared:  0.8205 
#> F-statistic: 32.99 on 2 and 12 DF,  p-value: 1.328e-05

title: Randomized Controlled Trials
text:
library(ggplot2)

#> Warning: le package 'ggplot2' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2

abtest_online <- readRDS("abtest_online.rds")
compare_chatbot <- 
  ggplot(abtest_online, 
         aes(x = purchase, 
             y = chatbot, 
             color = as.factor(purchase))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = 1,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = F) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "chatbot", title = "Difference in chatbot")

compare_previous_visit <- 
  ggplot(abtest_online, 
         aes(x = purchase, 
             y = previous_visit, 
             color = as.factor(purchase))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = 1,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = F) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "previous_visit", title = "Difference in previous_visit")

compare_mobile_device <- 
  ggplot(abtest_online, 
         aes(x = purchase, 
             y = mobile_device, 
             color = as.factor(purchase))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = 1,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = F) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "mobile_device", title = "Difference in mobile_device")

compare_purchase_amount <- 
  ggplot(abtest_online, 
         aes(x = purchase, 
             y = purchase_amount, 
             color = as.factor(purchase))) +
  stat_summary(geom = "errorbar", 
               width = 1,
               fun.data = "mean_se", 
               fun.args = list(mult=1.96),
               show.legend = F) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = "purchase_amount", title = "Difference in purchase_amount")

compare_chatbot







compare_previous_visit







compare_mobile_device







compare_purchase_amount







model <- lm(purchase_amount~chatbot, data= abtest_online)
summary(model)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ chatbot, data = abtest_online)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -16.702 -14.478  -9.626  13.922  64.648 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  16.7017     0.8374  19.944  < 2e-16 ***
#> chatbotTRUE  -7.0756     1.1796  -5.998 2.79e-09 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 18.65 on 998 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.0348, Adjusted R-squared:  0.03383 
#> F-statistic: 35.98 on 1 and 998 DF,  p-value: 2.787e-09



lm_mod <- lm(purchase_amount ~ purchase * chatbot + purchase * previous_visit+purchase *mobile_device , data = abtest_online)
summary(lm_mod)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = purchase_amount ~ purchase * chatbot + purchase * 
#>     previous_visit + purchase * mobile_device, data = abtest_online)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>    Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
#> -32.22   0.00   0.00   0.00  48.40 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)                 1.618e-13  7.633e-01   0.000   1.0000    
#> purchase                    3.434e+01  1.084e+00  31.687   <2e-16 ***
#> chatbotTRUE                 4.376e-15  7.410e-01   0.000   1.0000    
#> previous_visit             -5.214e-15  1.984e-01   0.000   1.0000    
#> mobile_deviceTRUE          -9.423e-15  7.668e-01   0.000   1.0000    
#> purchase:chatbotTRUE        2.363e+00  1.214e+00   1.946   0.0519 .  
#> purchase:previous_visit    -1.940e-01  2.794e-01  -0.694   0.4876    
#> purchase:mobile_deviceTRUE -8.148e-01  1.252e+00  -0.651   0.5153    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 8.911 on 992 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.781,  Adjusted R-squared:  0.7795 
#> F-statistic: 505.4 on 7 and 992 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16



model<-glm(purchase~chatbot+previous_visit+mobile_device, family=binomial(link='logit'), abtest_online)
summary(model)

#> 
#> Call:
#> glm(formula = purchase ~ chatbot + previous_visit + mobile_device, 
#>     family = binomial(link = "logit"), data = abtest_online)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                   Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
#> (Intercept)       -0.22185    0.12347  -1.797  0.07237 .  
#> chatbotTRUE       -0.96894    0.13564  -7.144 9.09e-13 ***
#> previous_visit     0.10606    0.03262   3.252  0.00115 ** 
#> mobile_deviceTRUE -0.07119    0.14530  -0.490  0.62417    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> (Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)
#> 
#>     Null deviance: 1329.1  on 999  degrees of freedom
#> Residual deviance: 1262.2  on 996  degrees of freedom
#> AIC: 1270.2
#> 
#> Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4

title: Probability Theory
text:
prob_of_s <- 0.3
prob_of_sbar <- 0.7
prob_of_t_knowing_s <- 0.2
prob_of_tbar_knowing_s<- 0.8
prob_of_t_knowing_sbar<- 0.6
prob_of_tbar_knowing_sbar <- 0.4

prob_of_s_and_t <- prob_of_t_knowing_s*prob_of_s
print("prob_of_s_and_t:")

#> [1] "prob_of_s_and_t:"

print(prob_of_s_and_t)

#> [1] 0.06

prob_of_s_and_tbar <- prob_of_tbar_knowing_s*prob_of_s
print("prob_of_s_and_tbar:")

#> [1] "prob_of_s_and_tbar:"

print(prob_of_s_and_tbar)

#> [1] 0.24

prob_of_sbar_and_t <- prob_of_t_knowing_sbar*prob_of_sbar
print("prob_of_sbar_and_t:")

#> [1] "prob_of_sbar_and_t:"

print(prob_of_sbar_and_t)

#> [1] 0.42

prob_of_sbar_and_tbar <- prob_of_tbar_knowing_sbar*prob_of_sbar
print("prob_of_sbar_and_tbar:")

#> [1] "prob_of_sbar_and_tbar:"

print(prob_of_sbar_and_tbar)

#> [1] 0.28


The percentage of customers using all three devices = 0.5%
The percentage of customers using at least two devices = 8.8% + 7.3% +3.3% = 19.4%
The percentage of customers using only one device = 42.3% + 10% + 27.8% = 80.1%

prob_of_a<- 0.04
prob_of_b_knowing_a <- 0.97
prob_of_b_knowing_abar<- 0.01

prob_of_abar= 1-prob_of_a
prob_of_abar_knowing_b <- (prob_of_b_knowing_abar*prob_of_abar)/((prob_of_b_knowing_abar*prob_of_abar)+(prob_of_b_knowing_a*prob_of_a))
print("prob_of_abar_knowing_b:")

#> [1] "prob_of_abar_knowing_b:"

print(prob_of_abar_knowing_b)

#> [1] 0.1983471

prob_of_a_knowing_b <- (prob_of_b_knowing_a*prob_of_a)/((prob_of_b_knowing_abar*prob_of_abar)+(prob_of_b_knowing_a*prob_of_a))
print("prob_of_a_knowing_b:")

#> [1] "prob_of_a_knowing_b:"

print(prob_of_a_knowing_b)

#> [1] 0.8016529

title: Regression and Statistical Inference
text:
car_prices <- readRDS("car_prices.rds")
View(car_prices)
dim(car_prices)

#> [1] 181  22

str(car_prices)

#> Classes 'tbl_df', 'tbl' and 'data.frame':    181 obs. of  22 variables:
#>  $ aspiration      : chr  "std" "std" "std" "std" ...
#>  $ doornumber      : chr  "two" "two" "two" "four" ...
#>  $ carbody         : chr  "convertible" "convertible" "hatchback" "sedan" ...
#>  $ drivewheel      : chr  "rwd" "rwd" "rwd" "fwd" ...
#>  $ enginelocation  : chr  "front" "front" "front" "front" ...
#>  $ wheelbase       : num  88.6 88.6 94.5 99.8 99.4 ...
#>  $ carlength       : num  169 169 171 177 177 ...
#>  $ carwidth        : num  64.1 64.1 65.5 66.2 66.4 66.3 71.4 71.4 71.4 67.9 ...
#>  $ carheight       : num  48.8 48.8 52.4 54.3 54.3 53.1 55.7 55.7 55.9 52 ...
#>  $ curbweight      : num  2548 2548 2823 2337 2824 ...
#>  $ enginetype      : chr  "dohc" "dohc" "ohcv" "ohc" ...
#>  $ cylindernumber  : chr  "four" "four" "six" "four" ...
#>  $ enginesize      : num  130 130 152 109 136 136 136 136 131 131 ...
#>  $ fuelsystem      : chr  "mpfi" "mpfi" "mpfi" "mpfi" ...
#>  $ boreratio       : num  3.47 3.47 2.68 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.19 3.13 3.13 ...
#>  $ stroke          : num  2.68 2.68 3.47 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 3.4 ...
#>  $ compressionratio: num  9 9 9 10 8 8.5 8.5 8.5 8.3 7 ...
#>  $ horsepower      : num  111 111 154 102 115 110 110 110 140 160 ...
#>  $ peakrpm         : num  5000 5000 5000 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 5500 ...
#>  $ citympg         : num  21 21 19 24 18 19 19 19 17 16 ...
#>  $ highwaympg      : num  27 27 26 30 22 25 25 25 20 22 ...
#>  $ price           : num  13495 16500 16500 13950 17450 ...

head(car_prices)



  


tail(car_prices)



  


modelall <- lm(price~.,data= car_prices)
summary(modelall)

#> 
#> Call:

"The most significant parameters are:enginetype(ohc and ohcv),cylindernumber(five, four,six and twelve), enginesize,stroke,peakrpm,carwidth,carbody(hardtop, hatchback and wagon),enginelocation(rear)"

#> enginetypeohc         1.500996e+03  5189.507548
#> enginetypeohcf       -2.240453e+03  4186.291965
#> enginetypeohcv       -8.666335e+03 -3778.310183
#> cylindernumberfive   -1.769255e+04 -5756.526294
#> cylindernumberfour   -1.782963e+04 -5269.025514
#> cylindernumbersix    -1.159348e+04 -2709.316066
#> cylindernumberthree  -1.358731e+04  4949.451134
#> cylindernumbertwelve -1.941739e+04 -2827.032165
#> enginesize            7.347203e+01   178.396665
#> fuelsystem2bbl       -1.569500e+03  1923.771576
#> fuelsystemmfi        -8.134945e+03  2052.909867
#> fuelsystemmpfi       -1.620436e+03  2338.991505
#> fuelsystemspdi       -5.239202e+03   151.421288
#> fuelsystemspfi       -4.425440e+03  5454.972678
#> boreratio            -4.552905e+03  1939.424404
#> stroke               -6.351094e+03 -2703.179801
#> compressionratio     -1.836863e+03   361.059971
#> horsepower           -3.459530e+01    55.182371
#> peakrpm               1.272152e+00     3.778780
#> citympg              -4.197613e+02   239.056414
#> highwaympg           -1.755422e+02   485.258537

typeof(car_prices$carwidth)

#> [1] "double"

plot(car_prices$carwidth, car_prices$price)
abline(lm(car_prices$price ~ car_prices$carwidth))







"As the width of the car increases, as its price increases. If we increase the width with about 2 units, the car price increases with about 5000 units"

#> [1] "As the width of the car increases, as its price increases. If we increase the width with about 2 units, the car price increases with about 5000 units"

modelimp <- lm(price~carwidth, data=car_prices)
summary(modelimp)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = price ~ carwidth, data = car_prices)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max 
#> -11461.9  -2736.1   -870.9    589.5  26156.7 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>              Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept) -174994.0    12663.2  -13.82   <2e-16 ***
#> carwidth       2859.5      192.5   14.85   <2e-16 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 5415 on 179 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.5521, Adjusted R-squared:  0.5496 
#> F-statistic: 220.6 on 1 and 179 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16

sprintf("Adjusted R^2: %.2f", broom::glance(modelall)$adj.r.squared)

#> [1] "Adjusted R^2: 0.93"

sprintf("Adjusted R^2: %.2f", broom::glance(modelimp)$adj.r.squared)

#> [1] "Adjusted R^2: 0.55"

sprintf("AIC: %.2f", AIC(modelall))

#> [1] "AIC: 3333.26"

sprintf("AIC: %.2f", AIC(modelimp))

#> [1] "AIC: 3629.73"

confint(modelimp, level = 0.95)

#>                   2.5 %     97.5 %
#> (Intercept) -199982.432 -150005.56
#> carwidth       2479.573    3239.36

"p-value: < 2.2e-16. So, the effect of the variable carwidth is statistically significant"

#> [1] "p-value: < 2.2e-16. So, the effect of the variable carwidth is statistically significant"



library(dplyr)

#> Warning: le package 'dplyr' a été compilé avec la version R 4.3.2


#> 
#> Attachement du package : 'dplyr'


#> Les objets suivants sont masqués depuis 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter, lag


#> Les objets suivants sont masqués depuis 'package:base':
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

seat_heating <- rep(c(TRUE), times=181)
car_prices %>% mutate(seat_heating)



  


modell <- lm(car_prices$price~seat_heating)
summary(modell)

#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = car_prices$price ~ seat_heating)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>    Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
#>  -7881  -5390  -3019   3431  32401 
#> 
#> Coefficients: (1 not defined because of singularities)
#>                  Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)       12999.4      599.7   21.68   <2e-16 ***
#> seat_heatingTRUE       NA         NA      NA       NA    
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 8068 on 180 degrees of freedom

title: Regression Discontinuity
text:
